text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (International 
(Safe Manning) 

in Fishing Convention) 

Labour Organisation Work

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972),
heading: 2. The European Union (International Labour Organisation Work in
text_raw:
2. The European Union (International Labour Organisation Work in 
Fishing Convention) (Safe Manning) Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 52 of 2024) 
are amended by substituting for paragraph (9) of Regulation 5 the following: 

“(9) Where an application made under paragraph (3) proposes only 
one qualified skipper, the MSO may issue an initial minimum 
safe manning document under subparagraph (a) of paragraph (8) 
with a validity period of up to 2 years, following which the 
owner must apply to the MSO for a new minimum safe manning 
document.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

16 April, 2024. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

1 OJ L 25, 31.1.2017, p. 12 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 19th April, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [156] 3

title: on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972),
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations provide flexibility to the Marine Survey Office in issuing an 
initial safe manning document for a limited period to allow a fishing vessel 
owner a brief transitional period in order to comply in full with the Safe 
Manning Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [156]
